column2: To control and coordinate the movement of the NFTI Air traffic      ensuring smooth,      safe      and efficient flying training.                  Coordinate with CNS/ ARFF/ ELECTRIC      ALS      / and other agencies for ensuring smooth and efficient functioning of flying operation.                  Provide      traffic information to all traffic in air and ground and ensure adequate separation/ Prevent collision between      aircraft          and also      to      maintain      the log of all flights      operating      at Gondia airport.                  Monitor          serviceability          status          of          various          sub-systems          and          in          the          event          of          malfunctioning /degradation / failure of any sub-system reports the same to respective departments as necessary for rectification action on priority.                  Coordination between NFTI Traffic and other adjacent Air Traffic Control      unit      .                  Report any incident / accident to      the ARFF and respective departments      .          Take actions      in accordance with      contingency plans to deal with      aircraft      emergency/accident as          appropriate      .                  Carrying out periodic R/W inspection.                  Air traffic controllers primary concern is safety, but they also must direct      aircraft      efficiently to minimize delays. They manage the flow of air      traffic          within      airport airspace          guide pilots during takeoff and landing      .                        QUALIFICATIONS                      SKILLS                  Preferably CPL holder and or with Flight radio telephony license      or with defense background, experience in handling air traffic.                      Minimum Passed 10+2                      EXPERIENCE      REQUIRED                      Preferably having aviation      experience      at-least      of 2years.                          LANGUAGE SKILLS                      Should be well versed communicating in English and aviation terminology.
